overview: The purpose of this Act is to emphasize the importance of compliance with the requirements enacted by Acts 62 and 199. [12] This is achieved by specifying that the budget summary must contain all required information without referring the reader to other portions of the budget and clarifying a unit owner's ability to enforce compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements. [12] The measure provides that any unit owner shall have standing to bring an action alleging a violation of this section against an association and may seek an injunction to enforce compliance by the association's board. [12]
policy_impact: The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by deleting language that would have provided that the condominium association has the burden to prove substantial compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements. [13] [13] The statutory amendment now strikes language that stated a board that has not prepared an annual operating budget and reserve study shall have the burden of proving it has complied with this section. [12] Instead, the bill clarifies that any unit owner has standing to bring an action and seek an injunction to enforce compliance. [12]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The most significant change from the previous version of the bill is the deletion of language that would have placed the burden on a condominium association to prove substantial compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements. [13] The previous fiscal note highlighted opposition to this burden-shifting provision. [12] The Committee on Conference amended the measure by removing this language and changing the effective date to upon approval. [13]
